steps.title: Launch & first impression
details: All tests begin by loading http://localhost:5173 successfully.
UI review consistently flags basic design issues (margins, inconsistent typography, weak colour contrast) on the landing screen.

steps.title: Create a task
details: Modal opens and fields are filled without problem.
HARD FAILURE – in the Drag & Move Task flow the “Create Task” button cannot be clicked because a still-open dropdown intercepts the pointer (z-index / overlay issue).
Other ‘Add Task’ flows succeed but still surface UI inconsistencies (button styling, label alignment).

steps.title: Task list interactions (move, pin, mark done / not-done)
details: Mark as done → works, but visual confirmation (strikethrough, colour change) is sometimes hard to spot.
Drag & move could not be tested because the task was never created (blocked in previous failure).
Pin to top – test stalls at visual verification (no clear ‘pinned’ state presented).
Re-open a completed task – action works but there is no toast / success message (hard failure logged).

steps.title: Bulk actions – Purge All
details: Purging tasks works but the confirmation dialog contains spelling errors (“taks”).
Success message appears, but again with misspelling and design inconsistencies.

steps.title: Category management
details: Edit & favourite flows succeed (name changed to “Office”, star icon toggles).
HARD FAILURE – adding a new category called “Hobby” fails; user fills the form but category never appears and no error is shown.

steps.title: Settings – Appearance
details: Dark / light / system theme toggles respond, but some sub-options remain ‘pending’ (e.g., Reduce Motion ‘System’, disabling Glow Effect).
Design audit continues to point out spacing / colour issues.

steps.title: Progressive Web App install
details: User looks for an “Install App” option (Safari PWA) but cannot find it – flow ends with four failed steps and no screenshots.

emotional_arc: User starts confident after quick page load. Mild disappointment sets in when first screen looks untidy. Filling the task form feels smooth until the Create button is unclickable – sharp frustration. Subsequent passes (other test cases) bring relief, but lack of clear feedback keeps confidence low. Repeated visual inconsistencies and spelling mistakes erode trust. Category-addition failure and missing PWA option add further frustration. Journey ends with mixed feelings: core tasks mostly doable, but polish and reliability feel lacking.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: When a dropdown intercepts the ‘Create Task’ button, users cannot continue – core action blocked.
next_actions: Close dropdown automatically once an option is chosen OR allow clicks to pass through.
Add E2E test specifically for Create-Task flow with open dropdown.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Consistent visual design (typography, spacing, button styles)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Inconsistent UI erodes trust and makes scanning harder; flagged in almost every screenshot review.
next_actions: Run a quick CSS audit (padding, font-sizes, button variants).
Introduce a component library lint rule in CI.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users are unsure actions worked (mark not-done, pin, settings).
next_actions: Add toast/snackbar after every CRUD action.
Ensure visual state changes (e.g., strikethrough, star icon) are prominent and accessible.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Errors (“taks”) look unprofessional and damage credibility.
next_actions: Add copy review step before release.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: ‘Hobby’ category never appears – data integrity issue.
next_actions: Add server/client validation and error handling.
Show inline error if name duplicates or request fails.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Several colour-contrast warnings; impacts users with low vision.
next_actions: Adjust palette to meet WCAG AA at minimum.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Failure suggests PWA meta-tags or manifest missing; hurts engagement on mobile.
next_actions: Provide explicit “Install App” button that calls `prompt()` when available.

first_tackles.description: Fix the dropdown-overlay bug that blocks the Create Task button (adjust z-index / auto-close).
Add toast/snackbar confirmations for create, update, delete, pin, unpin actions.
Standardise typography, padding and button components via a shared style guide – quick CSS pass removes majority of ‘looks off’ flags.
Correct all spelling / copy errors in dialogs and messages (easiest credibility win).
Ensure ‘Add Category’ API returns success and show error state when it fails – prevents silent data loss.
